channel.title: How the how did I get here?

item.description:
Portrait Mode is for moody bathroom selfies ;;

\endtext Victrola Coffee Roasters, Seattle, WA, USA

The important thing about the sky is that it is always there. It is true that it is blue, and high, and full of clouds, and made of air.

But the important thing about the sky is that it is always there.

\endtext Seattle, WA, USA // Text by Margaret Wise Brown from The Important Book

Amrita&Greg helped make this, the Seattle Poetic Grid, and so I plot a course, winding my way from poem to poem, untwining how others compose Seattle.

\endtext
\endtext NCTM Regional Conference, Seattle, WA, USA

The important thing about a plane is that it’s happy to be free. It pushes you down before it lifts you up, and it rumbles and banks as it turns, and out the window through its tears the world spreads wide for you to see.

But the important thing about a plane is that it’s happy to be free.

\endtext Somewhere over Seattle, WA, USA

The important thing about rain is that it is wet. It falls out of the sky, and it sounds like rain, and makes things shiny, and it does not taste like anything, and is the color of air.

But the important thing about rain is that it is wet. \endtext Text by Margaret Wise Brown from The Important Book

“Louise Bourgeois created Father and Son specifically for the Olympic Sculpture Park. As the fountain’s water rises and falls, father and son, each in turn, are engulfed in water and separated. It’s an impossible and poignant situation, as the two face each other with arms outstretched, striving to overcome the divide.” (from Olympic Sculpture Park Map & Guide)

\endtext Father and Son by Louise Bourgeois // Olympic Sculpture Park, Seattle, WA, USA
\endtext Echo by Jaume Plensa // Olympic Sculpture Park, Seattle, WA, USA

The important thing about a shoe is that you put your foot in it. You walk in it, and you take it off at night, and it’s warm when you take it off.

But the important thing about a shoe is that you put your foot in it.

\endtext Text by Margaret Wise Brown from The Important Book // Sculpture is Wake by Richard Serra // Olympic Sculpture Park, Seattle, WA, USA
